outputs.crs_descr: Public sector policy and administrative management
outputs.output_descr: The project name has been changed from "Papua Development Programme" to "People-Centered Development Programme" to better reflect the aim of the project, which is to strengthen the Government and Civil Society capacities to achieve the MDGs.

This project responds to the specific needs to support government budgeting and the decentralisation process in Papua, and will develop local capacities for data collection, analysis and use in policy making, planning and budgeting to ensure an enabling environment for the achievement of the MDGs. This project contributes to the establishment of good monitoring and evaluation practices amongst government and related programme implementers in the key focus/MDG-related areas, and supports the improvement of donor coordination.

The project aims at promoting the incoporation of yourng volunteers from universitites inthe economic and social development of Papua and to provide them withan oppotunity to connect with their region.  Through a "University Volunteer Programme" recent university graduate will transfer their skill, capacities and knowledge to the indigenous youth and poor communities in selected areas of Papua, and together identified priorities for development while simultaneously learning about indigenous culture.  In partnership with community-based organisations (CBOs), women's groups and indigenous youth, the community development volunteers will develop initiatves for livelihood creation and achievement of MDGs, making use of indigenous knowledge, their ideas and skills.  This project will be implemented under the umbrella of the UNDP People-centered Development Programme (PDP) in will feature cooperation with local government, UNICEF, ILO, Conservation International, Clinton Foundation, and two universities in Papua region.

project_descr: STRENGTHENING GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY CAPACITIES TO ACHIEVE THE MDGs
